resources.string: Trail Sense uses location data in the background. It is used for sea level pressure calibration in weather monitoring and to provide more accurate sunset alerts. [View Privacy Policy](https://kylecorry.com/Trail-Sense/privacy_policy.html)

Trail Sense is for informational purposes only and the developers make no warranties concerning the accuracy of the information provided by the app, which may further be limited by the quality of your device's sensors and the current environmental conditions.

By using this app, you understand that the developers of Trail Sense cannot and do not assume responsibility for any personal injury, death, property damage, and other dangers associated with activities where you would use Trail Sense.

The developers of Trail Sense are not responsible for how you use the data provided, and what you do with it is done at your own risk. While it can be used in survival situations, you should not rely upon it, always have backup plans and gear, and use common sense. And definitely avoid using Trail Sense (and your phone in general) while driving or riding a bike.
Tips for improving sensor data accuracy

GPS: Go outside with an unobstructed view of the sky.
    %s of actual location
    %s of actual elevation
    %s satellites

Compass: Rotate device in a figure 8 pattern or in all directions and move away from metal.
Estimate avalanche risks and the height of objects
Tap or hold anywhere to lock/unlock

"Calibration protocol: 
- Set this value to 1. 
- Measure the Trail Sense ruler value corresponding to one unit of a physical ruler. 
- Report the measured value here."
Rotate your phone in a figure 8 pattern or in all directions several times, click %s when finished.
Rotate your phone in a figure 8 pattern or in all directions several times, click %s when finished. \n \nThis alert can be disabled in the app settings.
Enter the current pressure at sea level in hPa
Using a known sea level pressure
Use the temperature in sea level pressure conversions
Show closest beacons on the compass
Trail Sense ran into an error. Please email the developer to get this issue fixed.
A how-to guide for using Trail Sense
%s and all its beacons will be deleted.
%s and all its paths will be deleted.
Tap sun or moon for position details
Measure the height of a cliff or drop
Only use this tool when it is safe to do so, and be sure to check what is below the cliff to avoid injury. See the user guide for instructions.
Position solar panels for optimal power production
Place your phone on the face of the solar panel to begin.
Measure the distance from a lightning strike
Bring water to a rolling boil
The strobe feature contains flashing lights, which may be dangerous for some users.
A notification to sync your clock to GPS time
Set the time to %s when the notification arrives

Decimal degrees (ex. 1.00, -2.00)

Degrees decimal minutes (ex. 1°23.12'N, 3°12.1'W)

Degrees minutes seconds (ex. 1°23'12.1"N, 3°12'1.2"W)

UTM (ex. 03T 12345E 67890N)

MGRS (ex. 27PXM 09601 05579)

USNG (ex. 14S NJ 39521 41744)

OSNG (OSGB36) (ex. TG 51409 13177)
Power saving mode on, some features may be disabled.
Changes you made will not be saved.
Backtrack is disabled in power saving mode
Disables some features to save power
Requires at least 4 satellites, improves accuracy
High level clouds that form a wavy sheet. The sheet is composed of small dots which almost look two dimensional.
A high cloud that covers the sky. It is transparent and typically causes a halo to form around the sun.
May indicate precipitation in the next %d to %d hours.
Mid level puffy clouds that look like cotton balls. They are typically white with darker patches below and can be spaced out or sheet-like.
May indicate precipitation or a thunderstorm in the next %d hours.
A mid level cloud that covers the sky. The sun can barely be seen as a bright patch.
May indicate precipitation in the next %d hours.
A mid level cloud that is dark gray and covers the sky. If it is not raining, it may be a stratus cloud.
May have precipitation for the next %d hours.
A low cloud that covers the sky. Objects don\'t cast shadows and it may be foggy.
Low clouds that look like a sheet of cotton balls with small gaps. The color ranges from white to dark gray.
May indicate fair weather for the next %d hours.
Low puffy clouds that look like cotton balls. They are spaced out and are typically white with darker patches below.
May indicate fair weather. If growing taller, may indicate precipitation or a thunderstorm in the next %d hours.
Low puffy clouds that are very tall. They typically have an anvil shape and are dark.
May indicate a thunderstorm in a few minutes.
High wispy clouds that look like tufts of white hair.
Learn how to use Trail Sense\'s features with the user guide. Available at the bottom of the Tools tab.\n\nMore guides will be coming soon.

- Trail Sense respects your privacy and location data never leaves your device

- Trail Sense will never require Internet permission

- View the [Privacy Policy](https://kylecorry.com/Trail-Sense/privacy_policy.html) (opens in your phone's browser)

- Some features of Trail Sense require access to your location

- Granting the location permission will enable the following features:

	- Navigating to beacons

	- Improved forecast accuracy (requires background location, not available on all devices)

	- Backtrack (requires background location)

	- Sun and moon times for your current location

- If you choose to not grant the location permission, you can manually enter a location in the Settings > GPS calibration menu in Trail Sense.

- After clicking continue, you will be prompted to grant the location and background location permissions. Denying those permissions will prevent Trail Sense from accessing your location, so a manual location entry is recommended.
Records cell signal at the waypoint. Does not use the Internet.
How to determine the beam distance of flashlights

The accuracy and battery usage of the pedometer is dependent on your device\'s manufacturer and the stride length entered. Try it out at home for a bit to verify battery drain and accuracy before using on the trail.
Enter the name of the map
Map auto-calibrated, please verify its accuracy
The actual frequency may vary as some devices have background limits in place.
Small intervals (under 15 minutes) may cause excess battery drain
Camera permission denied, unable to turn on camera features. You can enable it in settings.
Physical activity permission denied, unable to turn on pedometer features. You can enable it in settings.
Creates a beacon for the last cell signal location
The pressure may differ from that of nearby stations
Uses NMEA offsets for elevation conversion
Displays a notification when the flashlight is turned on outside of Trail Sense
Show on lock screen while navigating
Forces loading the latest signal strengths
May prevent battery saver apps from completely stopping Trail Sense
Your device does not have a compass sensor
Scan a QR code to import
Go outside with an unobstructed view of the sky.
Enable auto adjust location in settings.
Set the location override in settings
Set Trail Sense as Not Optimized
Enable Location or change your location source to Device Only or High Accuracy

To measure the height of a target that is %s away:

1. Align the clinometer to the base of the target
2. Tap the screen and hold
3. Realign the clinometer to the top of the target
4. Release to lock and see the height of the target

To measure the distance to a target that is %s tall:

1. Align the clinometer to the base of the target
2. Tap the screen and hold
3. Realign the clinometer to the top of the target
4. Release to lock and see the distance to the target
Enable monitor weather from weather settings
Text is too long, QR code was truncated
Estimated tides may be inaccurate. Please use an official tide table for the exact times.
Predict the temperature at a different elevation

- Designed for hiking, backpacking, camping, and geocaching

- Place beacons and navigate to them

- Follow paths

- Retrace your steps with backtrack

- Plan what to pack

- Be alerted before the sun sets

- Predict the weather

- Use your phone as a flashlight

- And much more!
Walk in a straight line, press stop when you are done

Removing battery restrictions for Trail Sense may improve accuracy.

On most devices, click 'OK', then switch to all apps, and switch off battery optimization for Trail Sense.

Visit [Don't kill my app](https://dontkillmyapp.com/) for device specific instructions.
Unable to export map to the chosen file
High tide once a day - most tides are not diurnal
Use an official tide table to enter reference tides for the length of your trip.
Official tide table websites can be found in the user guide.
The number of high tides per day. Most tides are semidiurnal.
Associated with fair weather, clear skies, and cooler temperatures.
Associated with poor weather, overcast skies, and warmer temperatures.
May indicate fair weather for the next %d hours if it is foggy, otherwise it may indicate precipitation soon.
Prepare for high winds and heavy precipitation.
Prepare for hot temperatures. Take extra precautions against heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
Prepare for cold temperatures. Take extra precautions against hypothermia and frostbite.
All recorded temperatures will be replaced with the calibrated historical temperature.
Temperatures are based on a %d year average of historical data and may not reflect the current weather conditions.
